BO.I2CBase.name: BO.I2CBase
BO.I2CBase.description:
A base class for I2C objects. Extend this class when creating an
interface for a new I2C device. I2CBase should not be instantiated
directly.

params.name: board
params.description: A reference to the IOBoard instance

params.name: address
params.description: The I2C address of the device

params.name: delayUS
params.description: The number of microseconds ...

BO.IOBoard.name: BO.IOBoard
BO.IOBoard.description:
Creates an interface to the I/O board. The IOBoard object brokers
the communication between your application and the physical I/O board.
Currently you can only connect to a single I/O board per computer.
However you could connect to multiple I/O boards if they are attached to
multiple computers on your network. In that case you would create a
separate IOBoard instance for each board you are connecting to in your
network.

params.name: host
params.description: The host address of the web server.

params.name: port
params.description:
The port to connect to on the web server.
Default = false.

params.name: protocol
params.description:
[optional] The websockt protocol definition 
(if necessary).

BO.IOBoardEvent.name: BO.IOBoardEvent
BO.IOBoardEvent.description:
An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by the IOBoard object.
The most important event is the READY event which signifies that the
I/O board is ready to receive commands from the application. Many of the
other IOBoard events are used when creating new io component objects.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.PhysicalInputBase.name: BO.PhysicalInputBase
BO.PhysicalInputBase.description:
A base class for physical input objects. Extend this class to
create new digital or analog input objects. Treat this class as
an abstract base class. It should not be instantiated directly.

BO.Pin.name: BO.Pin
BO.Pin.description:
Each analog and digital pin of the physical I/O board is 
represented by a Pin object.
The Pin object is the foundation for many of the io objects and is also 
very useful on its own. See the Using The Pin Object Guide on 
[http://breakoutjs.com](http://breakoutjs.com) for a detailed overview.

params.name: number
params.description: The pin number

params.name: type
params.description: The type of pin

BO.PinEvent.name: BO.PinEvent
BO.PinEvent.description: An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a Pin object.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.WSocketEvent.name: BO.WSocketEvent
BO.WSocketEvent.description:
Dispatches Websocket events: Connected `onopen`, Message `onmessge`
and Closed `onclose` objects.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.WSocketWrapper.name: BO.WSocketWrapper
BO.WSocketWrapper.description:
Creates a wrapper for various websocket implementations to unify the
interface.

params.name: host
params.description: The host address of the web server.

params.name: port
params.description:
The port to connect to on the web server.
native websocket implementation.

params.name: protocol
params.description: The websockt protocol definition (if necessary).

BO.custom.ID12RFIDReader.name: BO.custom.ID12RFIDReader
BO.custom.ID12RFIDReader.description:
Creates an interface to an ID-12 RFID Reader. Other Innovations RFID readers will likely work but have not been tested. This object requires firmware other than StandardFirmata to be uploaded to the I/O board. See [Breakout/custom\_examples/rfid_example1.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/custom_examples/rfid_example1.html) and [rfid\_example2.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/custom_examples/rfid_example2.html) for example applications.

To use this object with standard io objects in Breakout, RFIDFirmata must be uploaded to the IOBoard rather than StandardFirmata. See custom_examples/readme.txt for insturctions.

Is is also possible to create a custom application for your IOBoard that includes the RFID reader. See IDx_Reader_Firmata_Example in the IDxRFIDReader library example files.

params.name: board
params.description: A reference to the IOBoard instance

params.name: readerId
params.description:
The ID assigned to the reader in the firmware
running on the IOBoard (default = 13)

BO.custom.RFIDEvent.name: BO.custom.RFIDEvent
BO.custom.RFIDEvent.description:
An Event object to be dispatched when an RFID tag is read or when an RFID
tag is removed from a reader.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

params.name: tag
params.description: The RFID tag value (hexadecimal)

BO.filters.Convolution.name: BO.filters.Convolution
BO.filters.Convolution.description:
The Convolution object performs low-pass, high-pass and moving average
filtering on an analog input.
See [Breakout/examples/filters/convolution.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/filters/convolution.html) for an example application.

params.name: kernel
params.description:
An array of coefficients to be used with product-sum
operations for input buffers.

BO.filters.FilterBase.name: BO.filters.FilterBase
BO.filters.FilterBase.description:
A base object to be extended by all Filter objects. This object
should not be instantiated directly.

BO.filters.Scaler.name: BO.filters.Scaler
BO.filters.Scaler.description:
Scales up an input value from its min and max range to a specified 
minimum to maximum range. See [Breakout/examples/filters/scaler.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/filters/scaler.html) for
an example application.

params.name: inMin
params.description: minimum input value

params.name: inMax
params.description: maximum input value

params.name: outMin
params.description: minimum output value

params.name: outMax
params.description: maximum output value

params.name: type
params.description: The function used to map the input curve

params.name: limiter
params.description:
Whether or not to restrict the input value if it
exceeds the specified range.

BO.filters.TriggerPoint.name: BO.filters.TriggerPoint
BO.filters.TriggerPoint.description:
Divides an input to 0 or 1 based on the threshold and hysteresis. You can
also use multiple points by providing a nested array such as `[[0.4, 0.1],
[0.7, 0.05]]`.
See [Breakout/examples/filters/triggerpoint.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/filters/triggerpoint.html) for an example application.

params.name: points
params.description:
An array of threshold and hysteresis values
operations for input buffers.

BO.generators.GeneratorBase.name: BO.generators.GeneratorBase
BO.generators.GeneratorBase.description:
A base object to be extended by all Generator objects. This object should
not be instantiated directly.

BO.generators.GeneratorEvent.name: BO.generators.GeneratorEvent
BO.generators.GeneratorEvent.description:
An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a Generator object when its
value has updated.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.generators.Oscillator.name: BO.generators.Oscillator
BO.generators.Oscillator.description:
The Oscillator object can be attached to a Pin or LED object to output
a waveform. This is useful for blinking an LED or fading it on and off. In
most cases (unless you are simply using it to blink and LED on or off), 
the Oscillator should be attached to a Pin or LED object associated with
a PWM pin on the I/O board.
See [Breakout/examples/generators/oscillator.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/generators/oscillator.html) for an example application.

params.name: wave
params.description: waveform

params.name: freq
params.description: frequency

params.name: amplitude
params.description: amplitude

params.name: offset
params.description: offset

params.name: phase
params.description: phase

params.name: times
params.description: The repeat count from 0 to infinite.

BO.io.AccelerometerADXL345.name: BO.io.AccelerometerADXL345
BO.io.AccelerometerADXL345.description:
Creates an interface to an ADXL345 3-axis accelerometer. Use the
accelerometer to read the acceleration along the x, y, and z axis of an 
object it is attached to. You can also obtain the pitch and roll. See the
example in [Breakout/examples/sensors/adxl345.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/sensors/adxl345.html).

params.name: board
params.description: The IOBoard instance

params.name: range
params.description:
The dynamic range selection in Gs (options `RANGE_2G`, `RANGE_4G`, 
`RANGE_8G`, `RANGE_16G`). Default is `RANGE_2G`.

params.name: address
params.description: The i2c address of the accelerometer (default is 0x53)

BO.io.AccelerometerEvent.name: BO.io.AccelerometerEvent
BO.io.AccelerometerEvent.description: An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by an Accelerometer object.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.io.AnalogAccelerometer.name: BO.io.AnalogAccelerometer
BO.io.AnalogAccelerometer.description:
Creates an interface to an analog accelerometer. Use the
accelerometer to read the acceleration along the x, y, and z axis of an 
object it is attached to. You can also obtain the pitch and roll. This
object should interface with most analog accelerometers. See
[Breakout/examples/sensors/analog\_accelerometer.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/sensors/analog_accelerometer.html) and 
[Breakout/examples/three\_js/accelerometer.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/three_js/accelerometer.html) for example applications.

params.name: board
params.description: A reference to the IOBoard instance

params.name: xPin
params.description:
A reference to the Pin connected to the x axis of the
accelerometer

params.name: yPin
params.description:
A reference to the Pin connected to the y axis of the
accelerometer

params.name: zPin
params.description:
A reference to the Pin connected to the z axis of the
accelerometer

params.name: dynamicRange
params.description:
The range of the acceleromter in Gs
(typically 2 or 3 for an 
analog accelerometer). See the datasheet for the acceleromter to get
the exact value.

params.name: enableSmoothing
params.description:
True to enable smoothing, false to
disable. Default is false.

BO.io.BiColorLED.name: BO.io.BiColorLED
BO.io.BiColorLED.description:
Creates an interface to an bi-color LED. This interface is for the type of bi-color LED with 3 legs. One leg is connected to power or ground (depending on the type of LED - common anode or common cathode) and the other 2 legs are connected to PWM pins on the I/O board. See [Breakout/examples/schematics.pdf](http://breakoutjs.com/examples/schematics.pdf) for wiring diagrams. See [Breakout/examples/actuators/bi\_color\_led.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/bi_color_led.html) for an example application.

`COMMON_ANODE` vs `COMMON_CATHODE`. You can determine if your LED is common anode or common cathode by reading the datasheet. To wire a common cathode LED, connect the cathode to ground and the 2 anode pins to the IOBoard PWM pins via resistors. For a common anode LED, the anode is connected to power and the 2 cathode pins are connected to the IOBoard PWM pins via two resistors.

params.name: board
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard instance that
the LED is attached to.

params.name: color1LEDPin
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard Pin the
first color LED pin is connected to.

params.name: color2LEDPin
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard Pin the
second color LED pin is connected to.

params.name: driveMode
params.description:
The drive mode of the LED. Must be
set to `BiColorLED.COMMON_ANODE` or `BiColorLED.COMMON_CATHODE`.
`BiColorLED.COMMON_ANODE` is default.

BO.io.BlinkM.name: BO.io.BlinkM
BO.io.BlinkM.description:
Creates an interface to a BlinkM RGB Led module. This
object allows you to change the color of the led, fade between
colors and run preprogrammed light scripts.
See [Breakout/examples/actuators/blinkM.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/blinkM.html) for an example application.

params.name: board
params.description: The IOBoard instance

params.name: address
params.description: The i2c address of the BlinkM module

BO.io.Button.name: BO.io.Button
BO.io.Button.description:
Creates and interface to a physical button. The Button object dispatches events on state changes such as Pressed, Released and Sustained Press. The Button object also handles debouncing. The advantage of using the Button class over listening for pin change events on a Pin object, is that the Button class handles debouncing and provides helpful button events: Pressed, Released, Long Press and Sustained Press

`PULL_UP` vs `PULL_DOWN`. If the other end of the resistor connected to the button is connected to ground, configuration is `PULL_DOWN`, if the resistor is connected to power, then the configuration is `PULL_UP`.

params.name: board
params.description: A reference to the IOBoard instance

params.name: pin
params.description: A reference to the Pin the button is connected to.

params.name: buttonMode
params.description:
The mode of the button (either 
`Button.PULL_DOWN` or `Button.PULL_UP` if wired with external resistors or 
`Button.INTERNAL_PULL_UP` if using the internal pull-up resistors. Default
is `PULL_DOWN`.

params.name: sustainedPressInterval
params.description:
The delay time in milliseconds 
before a sustained press event is fired.

BO.io.ButtonEvent.name: BO.io.ButtonEvent
BO.io.ButtonEvent.description:
An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a Button
object.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.io.CompassEvent.name: BO.io.CompassEvent
BO.io.CompassEvent.description: An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a Compass object.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.io.CompassHMC6352.name: BO.io.CompassHMC6352
BO.io.CompassHMC6352.description:
Creates an interface to an HMC6352 Digital Compass module.
Use the compass to obtain a heading. You must hold the sensor flat
to obtain the most accurate heading value (just like an analog compass).
The compass is also useful in obtaining a rotation value in relation
to a fixed position. See [Breakout/examples/sensors/hmc6352.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/sensors/hmc6352.html) and
[Breakout/examples/processing\_js/compass.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/processing_js/compass.html) for example applications.

params.name: board
params.description: The IOBoard instance

params.name: address
params.description: The i2c address of the compass module

BO.io.DCMotor.name: BO.io.DCMotor
BO.io.DCMotor.description:
Creates an interface to an H-bridge to control the direction of rotation of a motor shaft. You can rotate forward (clockwise), reverse or apply a brake. See [Breakout/examples/actuators/dcmotor.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/dcmotor.html) for an example application.

Tested successfully with the following H-bridge: SN754410
Should also be compatible with the following:
SN754410
L293NE
TA7291P
TB6612FNG
BD621F

params.name: board
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard instance that the
servo is attached to.

params.name: forwardPin
params.description:
A reference to the Pin connected to the forward
control of the H-bridge.

params.name: reversePin
params.description:
A reference to the Pin connected to the reverse
control of the H-bridge.

params.name: pwmPin
params.description:
A reference to the Pin connected to the pwm control
of the H-bridge.

params.name: minVoltage
params.description: The minimum voltage (default = 1).

params.name: maxVoltage
params.description: The maximum voltage (default = 9).

params.name: supplyVoltage
params.description: The supply voltage (default = 9).

BO.io.GyroEvent.name: BO.io.GyroEvent
BO.io.GyroEvent.description:
An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a Gyroscope
object.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.io.GyroITG3200.name: BO.io.GyroITG3200
BO.io.GyroITG3200.description:
Creates an interface to an ITG3200 3-axis gyroscope. This gyro measures
angular acceleration around the x, y, and z axis. This object provides
the angular velocity of each axis. Proper calibration is required for an
accurate reading. See [Breakout/examples/sensors/itg3200.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/sensors/itg3200.html) and 
[Breakout/examples/processing\_js/gyro.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/processing_js/gyro.html) for example applications.

params.name: board
params.description: The IOBoard instance

params.name: autoStart
params.description: True if read continuous mode should start automatically upon instantiation (default is true)

params.name: address
params.description:
The i2c address of the accelerometer. If pin 9 (AD0) of the module is tied to VDD, then use
`GyroITG3200.ID_AD0_DVV` (0x69), if pin 9 (AD0) is tied to GND, then use `GyroITG3200.ID_AD0_GND`. 
Default = `GyroITG3200.ID_AD0_VDD`

BO.io.LED.name: BO.io.LED
BO.io.LED.description:
Creates an interface to an LED. This object provides helpful methods for blinking and fading LEDs. To use the fading methods, the LED must be connected to a PWM pin on the I/O board.

PLEASE NOTE: To use the fade methods, or to use an waveform other than `Oscillator.SQUARE` the LED must be connected to a PWM pin.

`SOURCE_DRIVE` vs `SYNC_DRIVE`. If the Anode (longer LED pin) is connected to the microcontroller pin, then it is `SOURCE_DRIVE`. If the Cathode is connected to the microcontroller pin, then it is `SYNC_DRIVE`.

params.name: board
params.description: A reference to the IOBoard the LED is attached to.

params.name: ledPin
params.description: A reference to the Pin the LED is connected to.

params.name: driveMode
params.description:
The drive mode of the LED. Must be set to
`LED.SOURCE_MODE` or `LED.SYNC_MODE`. `SOURCE_MODE` is default.

BO.io.MagnetometerHMC5883.name: BO.io.MagnetometerHMC5883
BO.io.MagnetometerHMC5883.description:
Creates an interface to an HMC5883 3-axis magnetometer. Use the
magnetometer to obtain a compass heading or rotation in relation to
a fixed point. See [Breakout/examples/sensors/hmc5883.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/sensors/hmc5883.html) for an example
application.

params.name: board
params.description: The IOBoard instance

params.name: address
params.description: The i2c address of the compass module

params.name: numSamples
params.description:
The number of samples averaged per 
measurement output. Options are: `MagnetometerHMC5883.SAMPLES_1`,
`MagnetometerHMC5883.SAMPLES_2`, `MagnetometerHMC5883.SAMPLES_4`
`MagnetometerHMC5883.SAMPLES_8` (default = `MagnetometerHMC5883.SAMPLES_1`)

params.name: outputRate
params.description:
The data output rate in Hz 
(default = `MagnetometerHMC5883.HZ_30`)

BO.io.MagnetometerEvent.name: BO.io.MagnetometerEvent
BO.io.MagnetometerEvent.description:
An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a Magnetometer
object.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.io.PotEvent.name: BO.io.PotEvent
BO.io.PotEvent.description:
An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a Potentiometer
object.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

BO.io.Potentiometer.name: BO.io.Potentiometer
BO.io.Potentiometer.description:
Creates an interface to an analog input sensor. This may be a
potentiometer (dial) or any other analog input that is connected to a
single analog pin.

params.name: board
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard instance that the
servo is attached to.

params.name: pin
params.description:
A reference to the Pin the potentiometer is connected
to.

params.name: enableSmoothing
params.description:
True to enable smoothing, false to
disable. Default is false.

BO.io.RGBLED.name: BO.io.RGBLED
BO.io.RGBLED.description:
Creates an interface to an RGB LED. This interface is for the type of RGB LED with 4 legs. One leg is connected to power or ground (depending on the type of LED - common anode or common cathode) and the other 3 legs are connected to PWM pins on the I/O board. See [Breakout/examples/schematics.pdf](http://breakoutjs.com/examples/schematics.pdf) for wiring diagrams. See [Breakout/examples/actuators/rgb\_led.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/rgb_led.html) for an example application.

The RGB pins of the RGB LED must be connected to PWM pins on the IOBoard.

`COMMON_ANODE` vs `COMMON_CATHODE`. You can determine if your RGB LED is common anode or common cathode by reading the datasheet. To wire a common cathode RGB LED, connect the cathode to ground and the 3 anode pins to the IOBoard PWM pins via 330 ohm resistors. For a common anode LED, the anode is connected to power and the 3 cathode pins are connected to the IOBoard PWM pins via 330 ohm resistors.

params.name: board
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard instance that the
servo is attached to.

params.name: redLEDPin
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard Pin the red LED pin
is connected to.

params.name: greenLEDPin
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard Pin the green LED
pin is connected to.

params.name: blueLEDPin
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard Pin the blue LED pin
is connected to.

params.name: driveMode
params.description:
The drive mode of the RGBLED. Must be set to
RGBLED.COMMON_ANODE or RGBLED.COMMON_CATHODE. RGBLED.COMMON_ANODE is
default.

BO.io.Servo.name: BO.io.Servo
BO.io.Servo.description:
Creates an interface to a Servo motor. Use this object to set
the angle of the servo head. You can simply specify and angle between
0 and 180 degrees and the servo head will rotate to that angle. See
[Breakout/examples/actuators/servo.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/servo.html) for an example application.
You can also use this with a continuous rotation servo. See the
description for the angle property for use with a continuous rotation
servo.

params.name: board
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard instance that the 
servo is attached to.

params.name: servoPin
params.description: A reference to the Pin the servo is connected to.

params.name: minAngle
params.description:
The minimum angle the server can rotate to
(default = 0).

params.name: maxAngle
params.description:
The maximum angle the server can rotate to
(default = 180).

BO.io.SoftPot.name: BO.io.SoftPot
BO.io.SoftPot.description:
Creates an interface to a SoftPot sensor. A softpot is a type of
analog resistive sensor that acts as a type of slider input. There are 
straight and curved variations. This object provides a number of useful 
events such as Press, Release, Drag, Tap and capturing Flick gestures.
See [Breakout/examples/sensors/softpot.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/sensors/softpot.html) for an example application.

params.name: board
params.description: A reference to the IOBoard instance

params.name: pin
params.description: A reference to the Pin the softpot is connected to.

params.name: softPotLength
params.description:
The length of the softpot in mm. 
Default = 100.

BO.io.SoftPotEvent.name: BO.io.SoftPotEvent
BO.io.SoftPotEvent.description: An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a SoftPot
BO.io.SoftPotEvent.exports:
An Event object to be dispatched (fired) by a SoftPot
object.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type

params.name: touchPoint
params.description: The value where the softpot was touched

BO.io.Stepper.name: BO.io.Stepper
BO.io.Stepper.description:
Creates an interface to a Stepper motor. Use this object to set
the direction and number of steps for the motor to rotate. See
[Breakout/examples/actuators/stepper\_2wire.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/stepper_2wire.html), 
[stepper\_4wire.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/stepper_4wire.html), 
[stepper\_easydriver.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/stepper_easydriver.html) 
and [stepper\_simple.html](https://github.com/soundanalogous/Breakout/blob/master/examples/actuators/stepper_simple.html) for example applications.

params.name: board
params.description:
A reference to the IOBoard instance that the 
stepper is attached to.

params.name: driverType.
params.description:
The type of driver (`Stepper.DRIVER`,
`Stepper.DRIVER_HIGH_CURRENT, `Stepper.TWO_WIRE`, or
`Stepper.FOUR_WIRE`).

params.name: numStepsPerRev
params.description: The number of steps to make 1 revolution.

params.name: directionPin
params.description:
If dirver interface, the pin used to control 
the direction.
If 2-wire or 4-wire interface, the 1st moter pin.

params.name: stepPin
params.description:
If dirver interface, the pin used to control the 
steps.
If 2-wire or 4-wire interface, the 2nd moter pin.

params.name: motorPin3
params.description: [optional] Only required for a 4-wire interface.

params.name: motorPin4
params.description: [optional] Only required for a 4-wire interface.

JSUTILS.Event.name: JSUTILS.Event
JSUTILS.Event.description: A base class for the creation of Event objects.

params.name: type
params.description: event type

JSUTILS.EventDispatcher.name: JSUTILS.EventDispatcher
JSUTILS.EventDispatcher.description:
The EventDispatcher class mimics the DOM event dispatcher model so the 
user can add and remove event listeners in a familiar way. Event bubbling
is not available because events are dispatched in relation to state 
changes of physical components instead of layered graphics so there is 
nothing to bubble up.

params.name: target
params.description:
The instance of the class that implements
EventDispatcher

JSUTILS.SignalScope.name: JSUTILS.SignalScope
JSUTILS.SignalScope.description: A simple 2 channel scope to view analog input data.

params.name: canvasId
params.description:
The id of the canvas element to 
use to draw the signal.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the canvas element.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the canvas element.

params.name: rangeMin
params.description: The minimum range of the scope.

params.name: rangeMax
params.description: The maximum range of the scope.

params.name: ch1Color
params.description:
[optional] The hex color value to use
for the channel 1 signal (default = #FF0000).

params.name: ch2Color
params.description:
[optional] The hex colorvalue to use
for the channel 2 signal (default = #0000FF).

Returns the capabilities for each pin on the IOBoard. The array is
indexed by pin number (beginning at pin 0). Each array element
contains an object with a property for each modes (input, output, 
pwm, servo, i2c, etc) supported by the pin. The mode value is the
resolution in bits.

return.description: The capabilities of the Pins on the IOBoard.

classitems.description:
Reads the current state of the requested pin. Listen for the
IOBoardEvent.PIN_STATE_RESPONSE event to get the response.
The response contains a reference to the pin object with its
state updated to match the current state of the pin on the IOBoard.

You should not typically need to call this method since the pin
states are maintained client-side. Use the getAnalogPin or 
getDigitalPin to get the current state of a pin or getPins to
get an array of all Pin objects for the IOBoard.

Cases for queryPinState are to update the pin state after a period
of inactivity. For example if multiple client applications are
using the same IOBoard (so multiple JavaScript apps connected to
the same Arduino). When a new client connection is made, 
queryPinState is called automatically to copy the IOBoard pin state
to the client. If for some reason you needed to copy the state of a
single or multiple Pins again, you could call queryPinState in your
application. In most cases however you should never need to call 
this method.
classitems.name: queryPinState

params.description: The pin object to query the pin state for.

Set the angle (in degrees) to rotate the server head to.

If you are using a continuous rotation servo, a value of 90 will stop the servo. A value of 0 (or < 90 depending on the servo) will cause continous clockwise rotation and a value of 180 (or > 90) will cause continuous counter-clockwise rotation. If your motor does not come to a full stop when setting 90 degrees, you will need to adjust the servo (there is typically a screw on the motor) to adjust

classitems.description:
Copyright (c) 2011-2014 Jeff Hoefs <soundanalogous@gmail.com>
Released under the MIT license. See LICENSE file for details.

Move the stepper a given number of steps at the specified
speed (rad/sec), acceleration (rad/sec^2) and deceleration (rad/sec^2).
The accel and decel parameters are optional but if using, both values
must be passed to the function.
classitems.name: step

params.name: numSteps
params.description:
The number ofsteps to move the motor (max = +/-2097151 (21 bits)).
Positive value is clockwise, negative value is counter clockwise.

params.name: speed
params.description:
Max speed in rad/sec (1 rad/sec = 9.549 RPM)
(max precision of 2 decimal places)

params.name: accel
params.description: [optional] Acceleration in rad/sec^2 (max precision of 2 decimal places)

params.name: decel
params.description: [optional] Deceleration in rad/sec^2 (max precision of 2 decimal places)
